Uses of Interface
io.odysz.semantic.jprotocol.IPort

  • Packages that use IPort 
    Package Description
    io.odysz.semantic.jprotocol  

    • Uses of IPort in io.odysz.semantic.jprotocol

      Classes in io.odysz.semantic.jprotocol that implement IPort 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  JMessage.Port
      Port is the conceptual equivalent to the SOAP port, the service methods' group.
      NOTE: java code shouldn't use switch-case block on enum.
      Methods in io.odysz.semantic.jprotocol that return IPort 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IPort JMessage.port() 
      IPort JMessage.Port.valof(String pname) 
      IPort IPort.valof(String pname)
      Equivalent of enum.valueOf(), except for subclass returning instance of jserv.Port.
      Methods in io.odysz.semantic.jprotocol with parameters of type IPort 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static io.odysz.semantics.SemanticObject JProtocol.err(IPort port, JMessage.MsgCode code, String err) 
      static io.odysz.semantics.SemanticObject JProtocol.ok(IPort port, Object data) 
      static void JMessage.understandPorts(IPort p)
      Set the default IPort implelemtation, which is used for parsing port name (string) to IPort instance, like JMessage.Port.
      Because {JMessage.Port only defined limited ports, user must initialize JMessage with JMessage.understandPorts(IPort).
      An example of how to use this is shown in jserv-sample/io.odysz.jsample.SysMenu.
      Also check how to implement IPort extending JMessage.Port, see example of jserv-sample/io.odysz.jsample.protocol.Samport.
      Constructors in io.odysz.semantic.jprotocol with parameters of type IPort 
      Constructor and Description
      JMessage(IPort port)
